Description: Limestone ostracon: on one side only, nine complete lines of a business text containing a list of payment in kind given by the workman Paneb to the coppersmith Amenemwia for engraving on a cauldron and to another coppersmith for finishing the work.
Cultures/periods: 19th Dynasty (reign of Merenptah or Sety II)
Curator's comments: Bibliography: J. J. Černy and A.H. Gardiner, ‘Hieratic Ostraca’ (Oxford 1957), p. 16 and pl. LVI, 2; J.J. Janssen, 'Commodity Prices from the Ramessid Period' (Leiden, 1975), pp. 71—2; K. Kitchen, 'Ramesside Inscriptions' IV (Oxford 1982), 229.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (136398) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/136398)
